skill.name: biomni
skill.description: Autonomous biomedical AI agent framework for executing complex research tasks across genomics, drug discovery, molecular biology, and clinical analysis. Use this skill when conducting multi-step biomedical research including CRISPR screening design, single-cell RNA-seq analysis, ADMET prediction, GWAS interpretation, rare disease diagnosis, or lab protocol optimization. Leverages LLM reasoning with code execution and integrated biomedical databases.
skill.summary: Autonomous biomedical AI agent framework for executing complex research tasks across genomics, drug ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill includes local setup and report scripts that write files and execute external commands. These behaviors can be legitimate for setup, but they expand the attack surface if misused or if PATH is compromised.

medium_findings.title: Setup script runs external commands
medium_findings.description: The setup script executes external binaries and a generated script: "subprocess.run(['conda', 'create', '-n', 'biomni_e1', 'python=3.10', '-y'], check=True)" and "subprocess.run([sys.executable, str(test_file)], check=True)". If a malicious binary is earlier in PATH, an attacker could run arbitrary code under the user account.

low_findings.title: API keys saved in plaintext .env
low_findings.description: API keys are written to disk in plaintext: "with open(env_file, 'w') as f:" followed by "f.write(f\"{key}={value}\\n\")". If the directory is shared or backed up insecurely, keys could be exposed.

content.value_statement: Biomedical tasks require many steps and data sources. Biomni provides structured workflows, setup scripts, and report tools to support complex research.
actual_capabilities: Provides a setup script to configure conda, API keys, and data directory
Writes local .env files and example scripts for biomni usage
Generates markdown or HTML reports from conversation JSON
Documents A1 agent APIs and configuration options
Lists LLM provider setup steps and model options
limitations: Requires LLM provider API keys to run real tasks
Downloads about 11GB of data on first use

use_cases.title: Design CRISPR screens
use_cases.description: Plan sgRNA libraries and prioritize genes for functional screens.

use_cases.title: Analyze single cell data
use_cases.description: Run QC, clustering, and annotation for scRNA-seq datasets.

use_cases.title: Assess ADMET risks
use_cases.description: Summarize absorption, metabolism, and toxicity for compounds.

prompt_templates.title: Gene overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the main functions of the BRCA1 gene and list key associated diseases.

prompt_templates.title: CRISPR screen plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a CRISPR knockout screen for autophagy in HEK293 cells with gene prioritization criteria.

prompt_templates.title: scRNA analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this scRNA seq dataset with QC, clustering, and annotation. File path: ./data/sample.h5ad.

prompt_templates.title: GWAS interpretation
prompt_templates.prompt: Interpret GWAS summary stats for type 2 diabetes and run pathway enrichment. File: ./data/gwas.txt.

output_examples.input: Summarize ADMET risks for these three compounds and highlight any safety concerns.
output: Compound 1 shows low permeability and possible CYP inhibition
Compound 2 has moderate clearance and low predicted toxicity
Compound 3 carries a potential hERG liability flag

best_practices: Provide clear file paths and data formats in prompts
Start with a small test query before long runs
Review generated code and results before decisions
anti_patterns: Assuming PDF output works without extra dependencies
Sharing .env files with secrets in public repositories

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it documents setup for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through provider configuration.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It requires API keys, can be slow for large datasets, and downloads about 11GB on first use.

faq.question: Can I integrate external tools or databases?
faq.answer: Yes, it describes MCP server configuration for external tools in a JSON file.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Data and reports are stored locally in the chosen directories on your machine.

faq.question: What should I do if setup fails?
faq.answer: Verify conda, API keys, and rerun the setup script with a simple test query.

faq.question: How does it compare to prompt only tools?
faq.answer: It targets multi step workflows with code execution and report generation guidance.
